definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: You may laugh at a prank on April Fools' Day.
sentences.chinese: 你可能会因为愚人节的一个恶作剧而发笑。

sentences.english: Watching those blocky minifigures walk around their sets will make you smile.
sentences.chinese: 看那些块状迷你人偶在布景中走来走去会让你发笑。

sentences.english: He made faces at the baby to make it laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他向婴儿做鬼脸来逗他发笑。

sentences.english: I laughed to myself thinking that this man was a serious re-enactor.
sentences.chinese: 我暗暗发笑，这还真是个认真的演员。

sentences.english: And you laughed, right, and I think you're supposed to.
sentences.chinese: 读的时候你们会暗暗发笑，这是应该的。

sentences.english: Now there were only three districts. I laughed at thethought.
sentences.chinese: 现在只有三个大区了，想想就让人发笑。

sentences.english: He liked to tell funny stories to make people laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢讲好笑的故事逗人发笑。

sentences.english: Well, monkeys make us smile, too, because they are creatures full of playful tricks.
sentences.chinese: 猴子也能让我们发笑，因为它们是花样百出的生灵。

sentences.english: Lucy was able to make her father laugh.
sentences.chinese: 露西有办法让她的父亲发笑。
亚历克斯已经开始发笑了。

sentences.english: He did it to make me laugh.
sentences.chinese: 师父这样做是为了让我发笑。

sentences.english: He laughed, and Mandy decided that the word “abode” made it funny.
sentences.chinese: 他笑了，曼迪想是“寒舍”两个字让他发笑了。

sentences.english: She tried to be funny- but the punch line didn't make anybody laugh.
sentences.chinese: 但是她那句逗笑的话却一点没引人发笑。

sentences.english: The laughing hyena has tremendous power in its jaws, enabling it to crack large bones.
sentences.chinese: 发笑鬣狗的双颌特别有劲，使它能够啃大骨头。

sentences.english: Hearing the amusing story, John couldnt contain his amusement any longer.
sentences.chinese: 听到这个令人发笑的故事，约翰再也忍不住笑了。

definition: cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
